title: Efficient Surgery
body:
Can I just thank you all for your co-operation in my health this week. You have all been super efficient and I am overwhelmed with how fast you have dealt with me.
 
I know as a surgery you often only ever hear negative things so I just want to offer my support to you all – You are doing a great job !!!

title: Suboptimal care - Maternity Services
body: I visited the antenatal clinic recently for my mid-trimester checks. Due to Covid, most of the checks have been included as part of the scans you attend so you don’t have to attend multiple times. I was made to wait 45 minutes for nothing only to be told by a midwife that it was my fault for waiting around as the midwives had already seen me before my scan. I explained that a midwife told me specifically that further blood tests would be carried out for me at the 20 weeks mark & the sonographer checked they would see me before handing over my care to them. It’s a shame that the staff member automatically assumed that I was in the wrong and was wrongly advised, even though it was a midwife from her team who told me this. I understand waiting times can be long, however I patiently waited until the midwife saw me, only to be made feel as if I know nothing? Patients do understand their care pathways & are more up to date about it then some staff members. I think the midwife should also be aware that certain members of the public may also have a better understanding of their care especially if they work in a similar environment. Assumptions shouldn’t be made that we don’t understand what’s happening to us. What should have been an exciting day for me was ruined by certain comments made by staff. It should be made clear from the start what checks patients will have on that day. I also found it inappropriate that this whole conversation had to happen in the waiting area, as several other patients could overhear the whole conversation. I could’ve easily been taken around the corner, so we could have had this conversation in the hallway away from other patients. I felt I had to justify their wrongful actions, even though it wasn’t my fault for waiting around. The waiting isn’t the main issue; it was the fact that the midwife made me feel so little in front of others as if I didn’t know what was happening to me. From a patient’s prospective, it was the incompetency of the department for making a patient wait in a waiting room with others for no apparent reason. The information given to patients should be consistent too.

title: Absolutely useless
body: I'm basically going to repeat what everyones said. Seeing as everyone is having the same problem of appointments being fully booked within minutes of being on hold from 8am, makes me wonder who's even getting any appointments??? I've been trying everyday and not been successful

title: Horible experience
body: Called the GP surgery 3 times in the last few days   unbehalf of my patient. I was on the phone for more than an hour, despite saying I am number one, no one pick the calls. I used later used two phones , yet no one pick it up. I believe its a deliberate thing. No surgery will say you are currently number one on the que and an hour later no one was answering

title: How do you actually see a GP?
body: How do you actually get to see a GP ? I have a stomach issue I haven’t been examined for well over a year just phone calls how can you diagnose over the phone ? It’s getting worse I just keep getting fobbed off so fed up as in pain.

title: Excellent service
body: I had a telephone appointment about my son and I wanted to let you know how well it was dealt with. The receptionist sorted an appointment and offered me the option to ring the next day for an on the day appointment but this wasn’t required. She explained the process well and gave me an email to send pictures to which would assist the appointment. The appointment was detailed and through by the doctor and I didn’t feel that it was any less of an appointment just because it was on the phone. The doctor was detailed in his information and considered in his advice. A prescription was organised for immediate collection. Made me feel totally at ease should future appointments be needed. Thank you for your kind and professional approach.

title: Quick Response, Great Care and Follow Up Care
body: I needed an urgent appointment, had a very quick response. Initial phone consultation was useful and then GP decided physical exam needed - fitted in straight away. Great communication and patient care throughout. GP even did a follow up call one week later! Outstanding care and clinical practice during challenging times.

title: excellent hospital.
body: I was booked in to the Circle hospital for a hip replacement. My surgeon was nhs and opperation was done through NHS.  I was only at the circle because of covid 19 affecting surgery at the Royal berks hospital. Although I was an NHS patient the staff I was in contact with were all realy friendly and diligent in their work. My room was a good size and very comfortable. The opperation went well had new hip fitted and with half from staff at circle and a great nhs surgeon I was well enough to go home just 32 hrs after surgery. I could have stayed a day or 2 longer but I felt well enough to go home they never tried to rush me home that was my choice. I would recommend the hospital to anyone who is interested. Thsnks to all staff who made me feel welcome and safe throughout my stay.

title: Very helpful, quick and effective
body:
It started at the Reception. They were very nice and kind from the beginning. Offered me help and efficiently guided me through all the necessary processes.
The doctor was also very kind and helpful. Quickly analysed the situation and prescribed the necessary medicine.
They also helped me to find the closest pharmacy.
Very good experience!

title: Emergency care
body:
The care and treatment I received in accident and emergency this last weekend was second to none. The nursing staff were amazing helping me keep calm and reducing my worry with their professional approach and cheerful conversation.
The doctors were also very friendly and professional. They kept me informed of what was wrong with me and what they would do to help me recover. 
The nurse, in the short stay ward, who looked after me until I was discharged was so caring I felt like a celebrity.
Thank you all for the great care you gave me.

title: Awful
body: Have been transfered over to Southampton for more specialist care, well all I can say it certainly hasn't been, far better care and support and follow up with previous hospital, my team actually cared and, responded to any calls made and had regular follow up, very disappointed been left with a large mass for over 6 months now needing surgery with the possibility that this might be nasty great care well done.

title: Fantastic Practice
body: I am upset to see negative reviews of this surgery as they have always done an amazing job whenever myself or my family have been unwell. The doctors, nurses and reception staff are all very approachable and caring.

title: Amazing people
body: I had a surgery at the Liverpool clinic early this year, I can’t thank the staff enough they are all soo warm and friendly, you are not judged for being there. They are all so kind and lovely from the nurses to the surgeon, the look after you like they care. From the minute I walked in till I got to the recovery room I was treat with dignity. Even got a hug from one of the nurses. Thank you all so much.

title: Poor outpatient pharmacy
body: Visited hospital  with my wife. Had to visit pharmacy for medications. Notice said no more than 4 people 3 patients inside so was asked to wait outside. However there was a group of about 4/5 staff chatting hugging exchanging gifts flowers etc with a staff member birthday I think. Masks on / off for sometime so much so that other patients waiting outside commented on how unprofessional it all was. At least 2 pharmacists appeared to work flat out trying to avoid the celebrating group. There were hundreds of prescriptions stacked up on the counters which added to the chaos. Also two nurses came in for a bag of Made up scripts Then stood at counter sorting out which ones each wanted. Celebrating continued in this chaos and patients In and out couldn’t hear if their . names were called out.  Another patient went to tell someone that they may have missed their Name which seemed to irritate the counter staff lady whose mask was hanging half off her face. Unprofessional chaos poor patient experience and risky behaviour but no other option available to get your prescription.

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor communication and information
body:
The surgery currently lists no less than 7 options to make an appointment, none of which work or are suitable.

TPP Online - appointment booking service removed
NHS App - appointment booking service removed
Doctor link App - the surgery is not listed
Airmid - appointment booking service removed
eConsult feature on the website - cannot make an appointment, simply get stuck in a loop
Livi video consultation app - not suitable for my issue
Call the surgery and select option 1 - the system is broken and terminates the call as soon as the option is selected.

The surgery also now expects to do all patient communication via Twitter or Facebook - what about the patients who do not have access to these channels?

A very poor service and incomplete and poor communications which has absolutely nothing to do with current restrictions or issues generated by Covid

title: EXCELLENT SERVICE
body:
At SpaMedica this week for a pre-assessment and cataract removal. 
Excellent care from beginning to end. Friendly and professional staff, superb cleanliness and amazing 10 minute procedure. 
All so impressive. A big Thank You to all.

p.s. the one and only criticism....the noisy fire door which bangs constantly during use and is very annoying for waiting patients! Any chance of softening the noise somehow?

title: Adapting well in difficult ciy
body:
This practice has adapted well to the Covid-19 pandemic, offering consultations by telephone and via a new service called eConsult. I used eConsult to sort out a repeat prescription issue I was having. The practice’s response was prompt and efficient. The eConsult says you will get a response by the end of the next working day but I got a same day response. My husband has also had reason to use the system and in his case he was promptly directed to 111 for advice about his symptoms. If you are having difficulty getting through on the phone I would highly recommend this service, accessed via the practice website. 
Another of their online services is online registration. My daughter came home from university to live with us during the Covid pandemic. She had to leave university without getting the repeat prescriptions she needed but was able to register at Dysart online and get the help she needed. 
Thank you for what you are doing to adapt to these very strange times. Keep up the good work.

title: Great expertise and care
body: I was admitted to Freeman Road Hospital for treatment for heart block. I experienced the best of care,treatment and kindness throughout my procedures and I was given a new lease of life. Thankyou FRH.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing staff
body: This is by far the best surgery I’ve ever attended. The drs take the time to listed and are very thorough with investigations. The nurses are friendly and reassuring. The clerical staff are the backbone of the practice and keep it all running smoothly. Quick appointments quick test results and really good telephone appointments during Covid. You all deserve a big pat on the back.

title: Excellent treatment
body: Everyone was most caring and kind which helped me deal with the lack of family/friends able to visit.

title: Lack of Support
body:
I received a voicemail 09/07 stating my child would be discussed at a CCDS meeting on 15/07. A week later, after anxiously waiting the outcome, I received a letter stating my child is STILL on the waiting list, and was not in fact discussed on the 15th as I had been informed. No explanation was given for this. 

Avoid this centre unless you enjoy waiting lists spanning several years ( 3 years so far). 

See my previous review below for additional information.

title: recommend this surgery
body: I would definitely recommend this surgery to others,really efficient, good staff and lovely doctors and they answer the phones quickly too.

title: Non existence GI service
body: Despite having appointment with one of the GI consultant the service was appaulling. The consultant never see myself in outpatient always asked a so called clinical nurse specialist to see and to pretend to do the job of a consultant. When asked why didn't the consultant do his clinic the answer is always because he is busy. May I know if whoever is reading this  why is the consultant of a non existence GI service be so busy??? Doesn't sound like you have any permanent consultants there

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Outstanding care
body: I attended the surgery for a procedure about which I was extremely nervous. Both the junior and senior doctor who looked after me could not have shown me more kindness, patience and compassion. They listened to my concerns and treated me with the utmost respect and understanding . I am so grateful for the treatment I received.

title: Great doctors
body: Went to see a doctor for a problem I have been having. Sorted me out straight away. Very professional

title: Telephone Harassment
body:
The administrators at this practice telephone me constantly.   The seem incapable of taking notes on previous conversations.  I have declined an invitation to come into the practice for a general health review, and asked them to stop calling me.  They have sent me a letter to say that they will be taking me off the register.  I have asked them to stop calling me on multiple occasions. This has been going on for over 3 months. 

They don't give a clear reason for why they continually contact me asking the same questions again and again.  It is unpleasant and a huge waste of resources.

title: Thank you for such a caring service
body: I recently had to have a tilt table test in the Cardiology Dept. The two staff who carried it out were extremely kind and understanding. They really took their time to help me to feel at ease and reassure me when I felt unwell. I was very upset afterwards, because of the results it showed, and again they were very thoughtful and helpful. I can't say thank you enough. It was the final step in a problematic journey to reach a diagnosis since my admission to Heartlands in May. I am very grateful, thank you. SH

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Thank you for such a caring service
body: I had to have a colonoscopy and endoscopy at the Vanguard Unit BHH. They were absolutely brilliant. Although it isn't the most pleasant procedure they made it as easy and tolerable as they could and really looked after me. Thank you so much to the team for their care and attention

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: lack of information
body: Tried to find out current situation for blood tests at Rowley Regis. Spent time going through website - there is nothing telling us if it is still walk in, or if an appointment is needed. Impossible to ask via telephone, so how do we find out? We need up to date information please.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Very poor practice
body: I would not recommend anyone to use this hospital. Very poor practice by nurses. Understaffed and uncaring. Poor management.

title: Fabulous people
body:
Just 24hrs since my surgery. Had to put a review on, from the time I arrived until the time I left all the staff were so attentive. For anybody having a cataract op, it’s a breeze, you just don’t know that anything’s happening, the only thing that is real is when your eye gets washed out with water.
Well done BMI and a stand out surgeon.
Thank you.

title: Quite a good practice. However...
body:
Although I have been usually very pleased with the quality of care and the professionalism of the doctors, I'm afraid I need to describe my experience pointing to irresponsibility and lack of care from the practice management.
Over the past year, they frequently mismanaged my repeat prescriptions. They were sending me items that I had not ordered or were sending them to a wrong pharmacy. After a couple of time this had happened, I requested to speak to the practice manager. I was assured I would be contacted soon, but this never happened. Since that first time, I requested such conversation two more times - guess what, no one ever called.
This lack of competence or responsibility from someone in the admin staff, who deals with prescriptions, is an accident waiting to happen. But they do not care.

title: Great surgery
body:
Victoria medical Centre is a great surgery.
Thank you for getting back to me about my request and the response was very quick.

title: Thank you
body:
I have emetophobia linked to PTSD along with generalised anxiety and as you can imagine I was a complete mess by the time I reached the clinic for my early surgical abortion. In the end I had to 
 make the decision to visit another clinic in a few days time but the midwife and Councillor that helped me were truly amazing. They didn't make me feel silly and ensured I didn't blame myself for my anxiety. They went above and beyond in making me feel understood and respected. Thank you <3

title: Thank you
body: For several reasons this was a particularly scary and hard day but was made so much easier by the care and professionalism of the staff. They went above and beyond to look after me, reassure me and make me feel at ease. Thank you doesn't come close

title: Very helpful practice
body:
They are always willing to help and offer prompt appointments.
The whole team is very friendly.
Great practice

title: Great Service
body: I recently requested for private health records which was promptly taken care by the Private Medical Report Administrator. She was real helpful along with the rest of the team. Many thanks for your support.

title: Made me feel respected and cared for
body: When I first made contact with BPAS at nearly 15 weeks about a surgical termination for medical reasons, I was broken and totally devastated. From my initial phone call to them to my discharge, I was shown nothing but kindness, compassion and a total lack of judgement for my situation. Unfortunately due to COVID, it wasn’t possible to bring someone with me for support when I attended the clinic for the procedure which was very upsetting when I first arrived. In all I was there for around 4hrs - 2 waiting, being scanned and speaking to nurses, 2 for the procedure and recovery. I was absolutely terrified when I first was called to theatre but each member of staff took the time to introduce themselves to me and reassured me that they would take care of me. Someone was holding my hand when I was put to sleep and someone was there when I woke up. I was never left feeling alone. 20 mins or so later I was wheeled up to recovery where I was able to have a biscuit and a drink, and have my obs taken. Again the staff were lovely and very professional when I felt so vulnerable. I hope I don’t ever need to use this invaluable service again, but if you should ever find yourself in need, the staff here will take excellent care of you and you will be shown nothing but respect and compassion whatever your circumstance. Thank you.

title: Great care
body: Received excellent care from all staff. Very well organised during this difficult coronavirus pandemic. Thank you.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Wonderful care
body: My elderly mother was sent to A & E in July by her nursing home and although her illness is very advanced the care she received from A & E and the two wards she stayed in over the next 4 days was wonderful. The contact and information we as a family received via telephone calls from doctors and nurses was also so kind and considerate and we thank all of you for everything. In very difficult times for everyone you should be proud of all of your staff

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Very caring staff
body: Was admitted fri 17 july with chest and breathing problems. All the staff were amazing always checking to see how i was. Got the most amazing care thank you all very much

title: Very good experience
body: The call with the doctor was very good, clearly understood my problem and explained the next steps clearly

title: Still waiting
body: Dizziness and leaking fluid from my ear it was 10.55am when I rang now it's 10.15pm still waiting. I understand there is more people then me but at this time of night if I need a prescription I cannot get one..

title: brilliant fast service
body: Really good fast service. Seen same day and good treatment. I use the Riverbank surgery and the service EVERY time I use them has been impeccable.

title: APPALLING SERVICE
body: I am asthmatic and started feeling that I  was developing a chest infection.  When breathing there is a rattle on my chest.   I spoke to a Dr. who advised it could be viral infection.  I asked if I could get antibiotics as I am asthmatic& the rattle is very pronounced like inflammation sitting in my chest.  But nothing was prescribed.  A week later I had to call an emergency clinc because no Dr. Appointments.  I was prescribed antibiotics because my chest was STILL rattling & I was wheezing.  I was only prescribed 1 weeks worth but I had an appointment with my Dr. at the end of the week so wasn't concerned as thought they would continue course of antibiotics.  However appointment cancelled & now have to call emergency clinic back AGAIN to get any kind of treatment as my chest is STILL rattling ( 3 weeks later) & was coughing up loads of thick clear mucus, which is now brown.  It is unclear what state I need to be in for my Dr. to actually have an appointment with me and to do their job of assessing me & prescribing medication.

title: Thank you
body: I would like to say thank you for the care and kindness shown by your team during lockdown, it has been very much appreciated.

title: Surgery locked
body: I came to the Hulme surgery yesterday for an ultrasound however due to a mix up we couldnt get in as they keys were elsewhere. Another doctor at a practise in Oldham agreed to open the surgery to see the 3 of us who agreed to travel over. The situation was not good especially since the toilets were also closed at the Oldham site and for the purpose of the appointment we all had to have full bladders. Although the situation was not good I wanted to praise the staff for doing everything they could in a very difficult situation to accomodate us.

title: Great service
body: In these very difficult times and with the accompanying challenges around trying to limit going into the practice but still needing the GP to review my condition, I've received the most caring and personal service.   The Receptionists and the GP were first class and I really appreciate not only the medical care but the way they made me feel supported.

title: Disappointing  service
body: After an initial phone interview with Talking Services  I was informed that the service would be able to help with the problems I was experiencing. I was surprised to be offered this help in a couple of weeks. During this appointment I was informed that I was being discharged from the service because my score was too low to warrant their services and time. The problems I presented with are still there plus feel extremely let down by the service .

title: Not great
body: Simply put was awful. Not everything can be dealt with by telephone. Need to see people (can wear masks and aprons if needs be) for some conditions. Will leave as hear other practices give appointments face to face with precautions. I cannot get one of these.

title: Wonderful NHS - Britain’s greatest assett
body:
I was delivered to A&E by a fantastic ambulance team yesterday 25/7 at 3:30pm after falling at home and dislocating my right shoulder.
I was dealt with most professionally and with a great attitude to my care. I was told what was going to happen at all times. Discharged at 6pm.
Sorry I am not permitted to name some of the great professionals working there but thank you so much!! Chris :-)

title: Barium swallow in Ultrasound Dept.
body: The two young ladies who did my scan were wonderful, they immediately made me feel comfortable and safe with their professionalism and gentleness. They were kind and considerate in everything they asked me to do. Oh yes both beautiful as well. Thank you both for making a worrying time as pleasant as possible.

title: Cataract removal
body: Could not have wished for a better environment and practice. I hope I have the same experience when I have my other eye done in a few weeks time. All staff were informative and helpful.

title: Really kind staff
body: I had an elective Caesarean section here a few days ago and the staff were just amazing. Nothing was too much bother and they were so understanding and kind to me before, during and after the surgery. They calmed me down beforehand when I was nervous and were always on hand afterwards to reassure me and help me with my amazing new baby. I cannot thank you enough for making it such a special experience and for the sheer amount of hard work you all do. I’m really grateful.

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Exceptional care and reassurance
body: I have just had my second visit to the spa medica site in Chelmsford for cataract surgery.The level of care and commitment to my well being was first class,their priority was to reassure and help me understand the procedure that I was going to have in a very professional and caring manner.Any questions I had were dealt with and I felt very confident and calm.I would like to thank everyone at the hospital for their care and support before during and after my surgery.I can confidently say that everyone at spa medica Chelmsford is a credit to their chosen profession and to the health service.I would have no hesitation in recommending them to anyone who has an optical problem thank you so much for my experience.  David. Saltmarsh

title: Review of Spamedica Wirral
body:
Excellent service. I was seen less then two weeks after my diagnosis and had my eyes corrected less than two week later. The whole process was very thorough and well explained. The result in my eye is superb, I have better vision that I have had for over 40 years.

Thanks SpaMedica team

title: Pink Rose Suite
body: Thank you to all the staff, admin and clinical, in the Pink Rose Suite. Friendly, expert care, fears allayed, prompt treatment and so grateful to have this service locally in such pleasant surroundings.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor communication
body:
Never once throughout covid-19 have I received any message from my practice. Re. Ways to access service. 
I call, no one answers, I email, get told not to email but call, I go, told phone appointments only to call in morning! Talk about a around-about! Why haven’t you adopted eConsult service like most surgeries in Lewisham? NHS app, is dangerous, I had a eye infection, told me to self care. Thankfully ignored and went A&E I was close to losing my sight. Do GPs actually do any work here?

title: An excellent service
body: I was taken into Bolton A and E with severe vomiting and dizziness. The staff were all professional, attentive, reassuring and explained at each step what was happening. I had a very thorough examination to eliminate the more obvious reasons why an elderly would become ill so rapidly. This put my mind at rest. The cause of my illness and follow up was very clearly explained. All this at a time when the staff must be under immense pressure with Covid 19 and patients are inevitably anxious. An excellent service for which I am most grateful.

title: dissapointed
body:
still waiting for a xray on my fractured collar bone which has not healed properly,had accident july of last year.
I keep getting told you can't do it yet

title: Poor communication skills of senior staff and bad…
body:
I had been referred to a department in the hospital after waiting for over six months and was given a phone appointment instead due to COVID 19.
The specialist was very abrupt in manner and I could hardly understand her!
I received through the post a 2nd appointment for October this year also a phone appointment.
I have requested I be seen/heard by another specialist with better communication skills/manners!

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: great practice
body: I was very nervous but every person I encountered was extremely kind and calming to me.  Everything was explained in detail so I was well informed about the procedure.   I would go there again.

title: I had to do all of the chasing
body: I was discharged from county hospital after suffering a blood infection. The hospital told me, that they would be writing to my GP, to inform them that I would need a continuation of the antibiotics that had been prescribed for me. I had to chase the admin staff at Weeping Cross from Tuesday until Friday for a repeat prescription. The Email had been sent by county, but no-one at WC had found the email. A patient who might be more vulnerable,  or less pro-active than me in getting some action from this team, may well have struggled. Unimpressed.

title: Great care
body: I attended A&E on the advice of my GP as I am 25 weeks pregnant and had been experiencing some issues with my heart. The receptionist was very friendly and booked me straight in and I was seen by the triage nurse and HCA within 10 minutes who were equally as friendly and put my mind at ease. I was then sent straight through for tests and I have to say, everyone I came across treated me with the upmost care and really made me feel at ease. I was out within 3 hours and have to say that I have not long lived in Telford and I am very impressed with this hospital!

title: Thank you
body: My son over the last twelve months has been admitted a few times due to his health. He has open access. From the initial phone call to discuss admission to discharge his care has been outstanding. My son has Learning disabilities and has anxiety surrounding the hospital; which is totally understandable. As a result he can be a little bit of a pickle and not the easiest patient. The nurses were patient, kind and understanding. As were the Doctor’s and they listened to my husband and myself. Our questions were answered and we felt reassured. The staff are clearly very busy despite that the care he received was superb. For that we are truly grateful to all of the staff on Polkerris. Thank you.

title: Fantastic service
body: Fantastic service from start to finish. I was in severe pain and was admitted in really fast. They took my blood pressure and all other tests almost immediately. I was also offered to take ultrasound scans to investigate properly into cause of my pain (which helped a lot to identify the problem and make a correct diagnosis... something I struggled with for months, visiting numerous doctors). Everyone was very professional but above all, very warm and sympathetic too, beginning from my lovely doctor as well as the nurses and finally, the ultrasound team who were very knowledgable and helped to find out what was wrong. I've been given painkillers and also regularly checked on. The amount of work these people do everyday is insane, yet they stay calm, professional and approachable too. I wanted to learn more about my condition and further treatment options so the doctor took all the time necessary to patiently respond all of my questions and concerns. The team also encouraged me to come without hesitation should I experience that sort of acute pain again. I am very very pleased, definitely a satisfied patient. Can confidently say I was in good hands. Thank you everyone at Southmead A&E on the eve of 23 of July.

title: First response is an appalling service!!
body:
Its critical that those who have had a bad experience with first response also have the right to have there reviews published.
I have contacted first response multiple of times and have spoken to each and every staff that work behind the desk. However there is ONLY ONE member of staff that actually does help and actually does stay on the call even if a little more time is needed and also does provide that support regardless of whether its helping the person or not. 
But the rest have no clue on what they’re doing and it’s disgusting as I would expect this service to provide help/support for people that are in distress whether if it’s acute or not!! This service is for mental health, but unfortunately when you ring up all they advise is that having a cup of tea will fix all the problems. I am disgusted that my confidentially was disclosed when I had made them aware on multiple occasion that I do not wish for them to share any information regarding myself other than relevant services - Police/ambulance etc.... 
It’s very hard on gaining trust with people these days, But because of having such bad experience where my personal information was disclosed and also having a member of staff talking to you like they own you is appalling.. I’m shocked and ashamed of reaching out to first response for any mental health support that I have been needing as they have only just made it worse for me and that is me losing trust with this service.... I personally DO NOT think that this was an appropriate. I have a lot of trust issues. For me it’s very hard to trust somebody NOW Having first response disclosing my information that Shouldn’t of been disclosed in the first place as I had told them that numerous of times. Yes this has deteriorated my mental health as I have given up on services like this. CQC Need to look into matters like this, Most of the staff behind that desk have no care in them and no clue on how to provide support.  I really do wonder how they were given this JOB ROLE? 
Unfortunately this whole situation has affected my well being even more. I hope you can view my point from my perspective.  All staff at first response need on going training. As the service is unprofessional and they FOB you off HOW DARE! Even if you are feeling suicidal the staff at first response encourage you even more but in different ways... how dare!

readBy.name: Bradford District Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Minor injuries unit
body: I visited this department on Friday 24th July with a knee problem.   I was seen immediately.  The staff could not have been more helpful or friendlier.  They were quick and efficient and x-rayed my knee.  I did not have to wait long for the results and treatment and cannot praise this hospital unit and its staff enough. It is a marvelous place.

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good surgery
body:
Very helpful polite staff.
Used surgery for few years and very impressed with treatment.
Reception staff along with nurses and doctors are very good

title: Removed from the list without my agreement
body: Was very happy until I was removed from the surgery because I have changed the address. I know that you had to change your gp if you changed your address but not any longer because you can chose where would you like to be treated which I believe is fair enough. Mind you I was not a new patient but already existing. Such a shame. I was told that they had to do it so the patients in the area could register (I moved only 1-2 miles away). And the practice is never really that busy. Never had to wait for hours. Doctors and nurses are wonderful. I was left without a practice and I am not going to register with the surgery that has 1* reviews near me. Shocking.

title: Going downhill
body: I have been a patient here for a number of years. Sadly, since a new younger receptionist has joined, the service has gone downhill. On several occasions she has ignored me and ignored the phone, concentrating on what she is doing. Leaving her poor colleagues run ragged. On one occasion,  she handed me my prescription  with dirty grubby hands and nails. Such a shame as the other ladies are so lovely and helpful.

title: Diabetic Blood Test
body:
I was very happy with the attention and treatment received when ever I contact the surgery I always receive good and polite response from the receptionist and they do their best of their ability to help me and give me advise if I should need the servces of a GP .
One thing I find is that due to me not having the knowledge and requirements of the usage of a computer makes it difficult for me in handling the present technolgy so only function in this area due the help of my wife, I am more at ease when I was able to respond myself to speak to a person

author: RebZ
title: Gastro problems
body: Struggling for months with digestive issues, severe heartburn and back pain. Doctor initially provided blood test which came back fine and said we could review in 2 to 3 months. The next day I rang 111 as the pain continued and was advised to take buscopan. A week later dealing with these pains I rang my GP surgery to be given an appointment in 3 days time with a nurse to feel my stomach. I have constant nausea and havent been able to eat for 3 days. They also requested a stool sample but I wasnt able to go. Passed from pillar to post, with no one taking me seriously - I now feel depressed, stuck and my arms and legs are tingling, I need to see someone.

title: Care, Safety and Professionalism
body: I recently went in for an overdue clinical test due to COVID. The surgery was organized with fantastic social distancing, all the staff were wearing masks. The nurse I saw was in full PPE, performed her task quickly with total care and a smile. I also collected a few prescriptions and Ann at the Village collections is always cheerful, helpful, attentive, and kind. This surgery is fantastic. Were so lucky with our NHS workers here and I am very grateful.

author: redrx98
title: Lack of empathy & professionalism
body:
My daughter 21 years old, mother of a 6-month-old baby, started to get very talkative and unstoppable train of thoughts. She could not sleep and became delusional. We did not know what to do her doctor was unreachable, so we called 111 many times on the day and night trying to get some help, but only promises to send an ambulance, that never came when we needed it. In the early hours of the following morning 111 called us back to tell us to leave until the morning and to contact her GP. After about 2 hours we were expecting no one we were trying to sleep, then two ambulance staff were at our door. They were very nice but as they arrived my daughter got more agitated. After some conversation, we took a decision that later we would regret, to allow her to go with them and her husband to the Croydon University Hospital and stay at the emergency ward. Big mistake.  
They took her to a room that contained a telephone, a computer and a life support machine, gas cylinder for the bed, oxygen pipes, door lock from the inside, a toilet and shower. A sink and tap in the bedroom as well. A completely inappropriate place at a busy A&E unit. A lot of noise, and SILENCE is not practiced there and not even mentioned. Staff chatting loudly by the patient doors and some staff members who seemed to be laughing at my daughter’s behaviour.  
The unit is made in a very inadequate way. It is like a call centre. Surrounded by rooms for patients. Very disorganized and no one tells you who is in charge or whom to talk to in case of any need. I felt that staff we encountered were badly trained staff and some badly tempered.  
Male patients in the mental health unit were let at loose at the unit, going into the other patient rooms, obviously unattended and I saw patients walking outside the unit at 3 am. Easily could have resulted in something bad to a female vulnerable patient. No cameras were seen at the unit to supervise anything.  
Very low tolerance to mental health family members who are not used to this environment and easily are put out the unit by the place that incredibly has a manager. The mental health patient is allowed to wander around without being disturbed. They do not let the patient family members know their rights. I feel that they are dishonest or are not in control of the unit. They say they have a mental health team there, but every day seems to be a different person in charge and no results or progress is made. The patient deteriorates and even the proper medication is not given. My daughter who refuses to take any pills did not have an alternative treatment for her illness there where she stayed for 3 days.  
They basically kept her under sedation at a dosage that I feel could have been dangerous and subject to reaction to different sedatives.  
No one offered the family member a form to fill up to tell how the experience at the hospital was, the only thing they said when the patient family member got desperate to get some information was to complain to the PAL’s team. Zero empathy. They mistakenly told us that my daughter was detained under section 2 even though the papers were not complete. The mental health act section 2 say that they have to assess the case and treat the patient. None of that really happened, because they seem to lack medication, facility and trained personnel. I would never ever take a mental health relative to any A&E again, I would go straight to a mental health hospital because as they say the patient as soon as they get to A&E they will be "under arrest", they cannot turn them back.  
Three days at that unit in the Croydon University Hospital. Three days nightmare, humiliation, suffering from the patient, three days without eating and drinking properly, only one time given liquids through the vein, suffering to the family members, lack of empathy by the management, lack of humanity, lack of professionalism and putting the patient against the family member in this NHS culture there is of ignoring the parents of the patient.  
Perhaps we all are the victims, but they are the ones to change it. Less false heroes, less arrogance and more professionalism, please.  
When my daughter was leaving the unit after three days and she was taken to the transportation car I saw the monstrous face of the mental health system. A car fit to transport animals or dangerous criminals. Seriously, people that decide on the behalf of mental health people need a consultation. There was no need for that last humiliation, she is not an animal, and even animals have more comfort.  
  
[Unsure about 'Staff attitude']  
  
[Unsure about 'Transport']

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Dixi Chic
title: We were made so welcome
body:
It is a year ago that my dad was in ward D7. He had a serious head injury and was quite poorly, he couldn't walk talk or eat, we had to travel from Stranraer every day to spend the whole day with him,  
We were made so welcome and the care he received was above and beyond outstanding as well as us, All the staff was brilliant nothing was too much for them and they had time to answer anything we were worried about xSo thank you all again to the nursing staff that cared for him after this covid is over we will meet again, he is doing great xxx

author: louw84
title: Dads care
body:
My dad has been trying to stop smoking, attended the chemist to start the stop smoking program was given patches and told to return a week later for review.  
He returned to the chemist today with burn like blisters over his leg and arms (anywhere he had put the patches) one was so bad he was advised to attend Accident and Emergency.  
My dad was seen by a pleasant receptionist and was sent to minors. Michelle was lovely with my dad, making him laugh and chatting away taking his mind off what was actually happening. Michelle reassured my dad and gave us a supply of dressings etc so they can be changed at home. She advised my dad to re-attend if they got worse or if he was concerned. Knowing he could go back if this was the case meant alot to my dad. He doesn't like attending doctors or hospitals as he feels he's wasting valuable staff time. But is grateful to Michelle for her care and compassion and humour!

author: Wisteria
title: Care Opinion.
body:
Thank you for printing my story, unfortunately whoever rewrote it omitted the dates I included, which has made the rejigged story read all wrong. If you reread my original story whoever rewrote it will see that for themselves.  
This has made the timing in your rewritten story completely wrong, so once the reply's are printed regarding the timing who is going to own up and correct the mistakes?  
  
Maybe before printing you should let the storyteller read your proof before printing.  
Even though I am not happy in the way you rewrote my story I still think Care Opinion is a fantastic idea and I wish I had found it years ago.  
I wait to see the outcome.  
Kind regards  
Wisteria

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Orchid136
title: My life
body: The food has been good. We could do with a Courtney everyday of the week, she is doing an amazing job. I have nothing negative to say about the ward. Everyone is sound in my opinion. I did already know how to relax... and I usually do it with headphones to calm down. I think it is cool that you are allowed to wear your own clothes but everyone should be provided with some slippers or flip flops Any non sock based item.

author: AbdnL
title: I hope the team know how valuable they are
body:
Our son has recently been discharged from RACH orthoptic department and we wanted to share our incredibly positive experience in homage to the wonderful staff we have dealt with over the years.  
From the initial preschool assessment at my sons nursery, each consultation and the telephone encounters we have received, the staff have shown exemplary care, kindness and professionalism.  
It was a worrying time knowing our son faced challenges with his vision, but with the knowledge and expertise from the team, as well as some hard work at home, he has made a significant improvement, for which we credit the dept and our son.  
With the challenging current environment, I hope the team know how valuable they are, and we really hope they can resume their normal, fantastic service soon for others. With thanks and huge appreciation.

author: Jan76
title: I couldn’t ask for a better team behind me
body: I had to come into hospital as my autoimmune disease was getting out of hand and wasn’t responding to treatment, I was admitted to ward 19 where all staff were so friendly and went out there way to help and be there when things got tough, without the care from my consultant and her team and the staff on the ward I don’t think I would be here now, I couldn’t ask for a better team behind me thank you to everyone who looked after me

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Pdep
title: Respiratory and heart problems
body: I phoned my doctors surgery complaining of shortness of breath and sore legs which feel like lead, my gp said to go to crosshouse hospital to get tested for coronavirus I refused because I know myself it's nothing to do with that, he made me an appointment for the respiratory clinic at the surgery for 4 pm I had to walk it there and I was exhausted and the waiting room was closed so I had nowhere to sit as I was exhausted so I phoned and cancelled my appointment, I feel waiting outside hasn't been properly thought out. I feel let down by my surgery and also the NHS in general including with mental health as I have been sorely let down as I also suffer from PTSD, I have no faith in our NHS any longer.

author: Big El
title: Expressing my gratitude not only for the care but the manner in which it was delivered.
body:
From the moment I arrived at the ward, I experienced professionalism, care and compassion.  
Arrived at hospital after a urgent referral from GP. Was met with a Covid test prior to admission to ward 7, Surgical acute.  
Had a battery of blood tests, x-rays and cat scans before consultant came round later to tell me that I was having appendectomy next morning and explaining clearly and concisely what would happen, might happen and what could go wrong!  
Next day I was wheeled to surgery first thing and everything went according to plan. Staff I encountered when I returned and was put in ward 8 were absolutely excellent and displayed empathy and compassion to all.  
I was released from hospital the next day but am expressing my gratitude not only for the care but the manner in which it was delivered.  
My only gripe, and I know there are tight budget constraints, was the food. A single sandwich would be adequate, the home-made soup was delicious and fresh fruit would have been appreciated.

author: Jim5571
title: Help I needed
body:
I was struggling with pain to my back and knees and low and behold I got addicted to prescription pain killers, which was also a pain, and I didn't know what to do and where to turn, this was effecting my marriage my home life and my work, after receiving guidance from a friend on where to go for help.  
I contacted Pathways they were very professional from the start, I received the help I needed and life now is looking good, if this option wasn't available I dont know what would of happened

author: Paul vol
title: Meditation group
body: I’ve been attending the meditation group every Friday that is being run by Amanda. The sessions have been so inspirational and have greatly improved my mental health during these difficult times, I always feel so relaxed and uplifted after every meditation and I. Always feel The sessions enhance my spirituality, which plays a very important role in my life. We always have a check in and a nice talk at the end and share experiences from our meditation. We also chat at about our well being And let each other know what we have been doing to keep us well and share some ideas together. I am very grateful to Amanda and Cgl for providing this for all of us and I always look forward to the next session.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Ding
title: Good to be in safe hands.
body:
Hi. I recently had knee replacement surgery at Raigmore hospital Inverness. My surgeon Mr Michels and his assistant Dr Kanya trauma and orthopaedic trainee led the surgical team. The surgery was a success.  
I was in ward 3b. Mr Michels and Dr Kanya visited me regularly during my stay and their presence in theatre and the ward was very reassuring.  
The staff in 3b were a 5* team. Night or day and at all levels. From those in charge through nurses, assistants, cleaners. They all, without exception, took a patient centred approach and nothing was too much bother and all this with a smile (I couldn't do it).  
On a less positive note, my room was directly above some kind of ambulance drop off point? The noise had to be heard to be believed. Helpful when you're trying to sleep.  
Anyway, it does not take away from the service I received. Thanks to all the staff, good to be in safe hands.

author: EMcG
title: As a healthcare professional his total commitment to looking after my father was outstanding.
body:
We hear so many stories about how healthcare professionals offering some of the best and occasionally the worst care possible . I want to give feedback on an emergency admission of my 90 year old father to University Hospital Monklands.  
From the time of arrival through A&E then Acute Medical Receiving Unit and then to Ward 20, the level of care and genuine concern shown by the many doctors, nurses and support staff was incredible. Nothing was too much trouble and there was a genuine desire shown by the staff in all areas to do the best they could to help.  
There was one member of staff who deserves a special mention, Kenneth a Charge Nurse in Ward 20. He consistently demonstrated an absolutely unparalleled level of care and compassion the best I have ever witnessed .As a healthcare professional his total commitment to looking after my father was outstanding.  
Words alone cannot express our thanks to him especially but indeed all the healthcare professionals encountered during his hospital stay. My dad is now home and receiving a superb aftercare service from the Hospital at Home team. Heartfelt thanks to everyone who supported my father and please keep up this remarkable level of care and patient support.  
Thank you

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Quality care
body: I attended A&E on a Sunday afternoon in July. It was fairly busy and there were some impatient people (to put it mildly). All staff I interacted with were professional, calm and kind. I was seen quickly and I received a thorough examination. Quality care by all in difficult circumstances. Well done and thank you!

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Exceptional performance by the Orthopaedics…
body:
I recently had an accident with a bench saw, severing part of my right thumb above the knuckle. This was at 10.30 am my wife took me to A&E at New Cross were treatment began immediately.  I was assessed, X-rayed and in no time at all the Consultant Orthopaedic Surgeon examined me and indicated that, if I was OK with local anaesthetic, he would carry out the operation immediately.  I agreed and he completed the operation backed by his team.  The Consultant’s professional, confident, reassuring, friendly and jovial approach totally relaxed me and a took away my apprehension. The operation, in my opinion, was completed very quickly causing me no pain or discomfort whatsoever.  A member of Consultant’s team told me that I had been unlucky to have the accident but very lucky to have this particular Consultant to carry out the operation as he is a true expert in his field, which I can agree with wholeheartedly.  Everything went like clockwork; quickly and efficiently.  As stated, the accident was at 10.30am and I was back at home by 2.30pm which included one hours travelling time.  I would say that it would be impossible to get better treatment or service anywhere.

The follow up service that I received at the nurse led orthopaedic clinic was also first class, friendly, professional and reassuring.  When I was about to be discharged I had further indication of the high esteem in which the Consultant is held; the nurse in charge said he is fantastic.  The nurse was right, he was there as soon as the bandages were off.  He examined my thumb and, as with the operation, his manner was very friendly, professional and reassuring.  I was relieved to be told that the thumb was healing well and that I could be discharged.  

In all I can honestly say that every member of staff at New Cross that I met were absolutely first-class, demonstrating outstanding commitment to duty particularly when you take into account that we are in the midst of a pandemic.  A big “thumbs up” from me, or should I say a nicely recontoured shorter thumb!

 A master class in surgery – A big “Thank You” again to New Cross and also for the NHS. 

David Southall

author: Granny Val
title: Dermatology Treatment
body: I had a lesion on my nose removed by David and Gerry at Dermatology Day Care Service at Stirling Community Hospital.   The professional approach and sympathetic manner of both were excellent.   Many thanks.

author: Maps
title: Weekly telephone appointment
body: I came to St George's because of my eating disorder, I was made to feel at ease and given time to explain my past issues with my mental health. I was given a weekly appointment but due to the COVID 19 pandemic I wasn't able to do face to face appointments, I was telephoned sraight away to be offered a weekly telephone appointment which has been so helpful for me during these strange times.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Not so good, unfortunately
body: Had a choice of the two practices, having seen there leaflet, i decided to go with Beckett. May have a nice glossy leaflet but the service at the practice is shabby as an old paper. Manager not in sync with the admin team and also the GP - very poor communication amongst them - Registered with the other surgery - Very pleased i did. Beckett doesn't need to reply but need to show actions rather than words.

title: What service - there is no service
body: I'm sure the staff are trying their hardest but this service does not exist as far as I am concerned. Children with serious mental health issues are being left to rot and there is no help available. It has taken me 3 years but I have finally given up pretending there is any help out there, unless you have money to pay for it.

readBy.name: North East London NHS  Foundation Trust

title: Poor
body: We have been on the telephone for 40 minutes ( twice )trying to book an appointment , nobody answers then the phone goes dead. We tried to book an appointment with the app and the app says contact the surgery. The service here has always been bad since Modility have been involved but now there just isn’t any service , it’s as if they don’t want any patients

title: Extremely frustrating and unprofessional
body: After receiving a telephone appointment from a doctor I am advised to call back the following day at 8am to come in for tests that would enable me to be prescribed the medication I need. I call the practice to be told no, the doctor has to book me in and he is not in untill Sunday, (its Monday) I ask why would he of told me to call at 8am then and not book me in himself? I am then advised I cannot be seen and I have to have another phone call appointment with a different doctor to start the process all over again. This is a mental health issue and each day this goes by feels like a life time and to be told conflicting information and be spoken to rudely by staff members is frankly disgusting considering the nature of the issue. I am at a loss with what to do and just need help that they do not seek to want to give :(

title: frustrated
body: first time of negative experience. virtual appt scheduled but never received text message as per letter, consult calked mobile which never rang due to poor signal , called land line which is not connected and have told you it is not on several occasions. called to ask for another attempt and no response to this, sent in email with details , no response, meanwhile i continue to be in pain. virtual consults are great if you follow the instructions you are sending out and make some adjustments for people who live in poor signal areas. had the instructions been followed i would t ha r had a problem. had i known you weren’t going to follow instructions i would have driven to area where i can get a decent signal . this is my first issue with DHC in eleven years and appreciate this is unusual times and hope it is a one off and i get some response soon

author: Riecl
title: Palliative Care treatment
body:
I am currently being looked after by the palliative care team in Fife, alongside my local GP Dr McDonald. Since coming under their care I just can not thank them enough for the wonderful work they have done in improving my quality of life over these last few weeks. Gail, the palliative care nurse, has been so helpful and has always done exactly what she has promised and she is an absolute credit to the palliative care service. The communication between Gail and the GP’s seems to work really well and I have been lucky to have had some great quality days over the last month.  
I just wanted to put on record how much I appreciate the support I am getting.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: pbonsall
title: Alcohol misuse
body: Alcohol misuse. I felt bad, out of control and concerned about the consequences.

title: Amazing department
body: Having no positive experiences when visiting other departments from the hospital I’m very nervous about going. On Friday night I had to go in for severe pain. As soon as I arrived at the maternity ward all of the staff on triage was extremely helpful and reassuring! They talked me through everything that was happening, gave me plenty of reassurance that my baby was okay and did everything they could to help me feel settled and looked after. I then was moved onto M2 where the midwives and doctors where just as amazing. Day and night they was always on hand with a friendly face and did everything they could of make the experience less scary and more relaxing for me. When I needed pain relief or any scans they explained it fully to me so I understood what it was and why I needed it. Even when I was just feeling a bit down and worried about my baby they was there to have a chat with and Just made me feel like I wasn’t alone. Absolutely amazing service from start to finish and definitely made me feel more at ease about going in for labour! One student midwife in particular (I can’t remember her name but she is originally from Bassetlaw) was amazing. Super friendly and helpful and even when she was just going around doing observations she would sit and talk to me and have a friendly chat. Made me feel like I had a friend I could talk to a smiley friendly face really does make any experience more comforting. They treated me for kidney infections and continuously monitored my baby and they did a fantastic job. They really do not get enough credit for what they do! THANK YOU!

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: OzzyP
title: To say thank you to the nurses that I dealt with
body: I was in at the pre assessment ward and saw two staff members called Tracie (a healthcare support worker) and Jackie (a senior charge nurse). They were both extremely helpful and put me very much at ease. Thank you for all your help.
